item.title: 8-bit 2D dungeon RPG Crescent Tower for PC launches in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/8-bit-2d-dungeon-rpg-crescent-tower-for-pc-launches-in-2025

  • PC

Published by AMATA Games.

AMATA Games will release Crescent Tower, a 8-bit 2D dungeon RPG by Japanese independent developer Curry Croquette, for PC via Steam in 2025, the publisher announced. It will support English, French, German, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, and Korean language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A story woven from courage.

A fusion of nostalgia and novelty awaits you!

An authentic 8-bit style dungeon crawler RPG packed with retro style, intended for the NES generation and all RPG fans!

Story

Crescent Tower, an unprecedented dungeon that appears just once every 50 years in the Imperial Capital Mayirdoam.

No one knows what lies at the top, yet rumors abound of a jewel that grants any wish the heart desires and of a potion of immortality. To finally discover what lies at the top of such a mysterious tower, nameless adventurers flock to Mayirdoam…

You were one of those brave souls who set out to venture into this Crescent Tower.

Key Features

  • Simple Turn-Based Battles – Easy to pick up but highly strategic turn-based battles. Pixel art characters wage combat on a side-view battle screen!
  • Choose a Character From Three Races x Nine Classes – Freely create your own character from 3 races and 9 classes (jobs) at the Adventurers’ Guild! Your character will grow ever stronger by repeatedly changing jobs while transferring skills already learned.
  • View All 10 Levels of the Dungeon From a 2D Top-Down Perspective – Explore all 10 levels of the dungeon from a 2D, top-down perspective. The search area around you will expand by lighting torches to ensure visibility.
  • The Dungeon is Filled With Traps and Mysteries… Map It Out as You Proceed! – The 10-level dungeon is littered with various traps. The key to success is to advance while mapping out the area a little bit at a time.
  • Game Length – 10 to 20 hours on average!

item.title: Asura The Striker launches April 24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/asura-the-striker-launches-april-24

  • PC

Arcade-style 3D shoot 'em up dated.

Arcade-style 3D shoot ’em up Asura The Striker will launch for PC via Steam on April 24 for $14.99, developer LeftOver announced. A 10 percent-off discount will be available at launch, as well as a digital soundtrack.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A fast-paced, retro-inspired 3D shooting action game created as a heartfelt homage to arcade classics from the ’80s and ’90s.

You are ASURA, a humanoid combat weapon built to eliminate an alien invasion from space. Master high-speed shooting, powerful melee attacks, and time-bending slow motion mechanics.

  • Energy Shot – Your rapid-fire ranged weapon
  • Shining Knuckle – A charged punch for devastating damage
  • Lightning Over Drive – Slow down time and control the battlefield

Key Features

  • High-speed 3D shooting action.
  • Close-range “cooperative punch” combos.
  • Slow-motion system for precision and style.
  • Multiple stage paths for replayability.

Core Action

  • Wipe out swarms of alien invaders!
  • Use Lightning Over Drive to escape danger!
  • Destroy powerful enemies with a single punch!
  • Face off against terrifying alien bosses!

Controls

  • Movement – Use the left stick or D-pad. (You can toggle whether the character auto-centers when in a neutral position.)
  • Energy Shot – Press the shot button to fire.
  • Shining Knuckle – Hold the punch button, then release to strike.
  • Lightning Over Drive – Press the slow button to slow time (consumes energy gauge).
